utterances.speaker: HANNITY

The laws that we thought were broken, what the judge said on Friday said was the Florida constitution not being abided by, what happens in those cases.

utterances.speaker: BONDI

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

This is not just a Florida issue. This impacts all the country.

utterances.speaker: BONDI

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

It's unbelievable. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb15', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb15', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } Pam Bondi, thank you. utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. The recount continues tonight in Florida. But, first, according to new reports, Senator Lindsey Graham may be the next chair of the Judiciary Committee as Senator Grassley weighs his departure, increasing the chances of a full investigation into the FBI, their handling of the Clinton email probe. And joining us now with more reaction, South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } Senator, good to see you.

utterances.speaker: SEN. LINDSEY GRAHAM, R-S.C.
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Before we get to that, I want to ask you about your thoughts on the recount and all of a sudden, you know, 80,000 here, 15,000 here, they just keep showing up.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, if Rick Scott had not weighed in the way he did, and President Trump had not spoken up, I think they would've stole this thing from us. Ninety-something thousand votes counted after the polls close.  We stopped the bleeding. He has a lead now that can't be overcome in my view by a recount. So, I think Rick Scott is going to win this and I think mathematically Nelson is eliminated. But thank God that President Trump and Rick Scott took this seriously.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Senator, we have a lot of important judicial appointments.  We have the threat by Jeff Flake tonight about protecting Mueller. And I know you said that is fine, but the president said he has no intention of firing Mueller. It looks like some agreement has been made by the reports I read, between the president's lawyers and the special counsel, written answers. That would mean this is now coming to an end, at least in my mind.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, this is a manufactured problem. President Trump is not going to fire Mueller. Mueller is going to be allowed to do his job. And we need conservative judges on the bench, as many as we can, as often as we can get them. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } I don't know what Senator Grassley is going to do. He's been a great chairman of the committee. If I'm chairman next chairman, we are going to do judges, judges, and more judges. And at the end of the day, I am convinced that Mr. Mueller will be allowed to do his job. I've not seen one scintilla of evidence of collusion. The obstruction of justice thing never made any sense to me. You can fire somebody who works as a political employment, the FBI director can be fired for almost any reason. And the Democrats wanted Comey fired. So, I feel good about everything right now.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: In many things, I think you had a key moment in the Kavanaugh hearings when you spoke up. It was a powerful moment and an important one in terms of what was going on with Justice now Kavanaugh. And one of the people that made the most outrageous claims was Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: He's facing serious charges tonight. But that story, we now know, it changed with the client that he was representing. It changed pretty dramatically in terms of what she said. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } He made these accusations, and as I've been playing, I'm not saying this -- I believe in due process and the presumption of innocence, especially with serious charges. It has served this country so well. And to not be consistent, make me a hypocrite, I am consistent. But I wonder if you have thoughts about this tonight.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, number one, Ms. Swetnick's affidavit on its face just made no sense. Who would repeatedly go to parties for women who are being drugged and raped and not say anything about it and keep putting yourself at risk? So, the claim by Ms. Swetnick that was authored by Mr. Avenatti actually helped us because it was over the top. Now, he's being charged, seems like a credible allegation, but he's entitled to the presumption of innocence. And I will give him that do.  I'm not out to get Mr. Avenatti by turning the legal system upside down.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Nor am I. Whatever is fair, right, just, moral, let's stay with that.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Right, exactly.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You said you are ready, perhaps, to reopen the Hillary email investigation. We know the Democrats in the House, they've been doing hundreds of different investigations. This is what is important to me, and people have said, well, why do you talk about Clinton? Because it's -- do we have dual justice system, or equal justice under the law, equal application of our laws? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } That would mean an exoneration before an investigation in the case of Hillary Clinton. That would mean if we are going to talk about Russia and Russian influence, that has to go to the dossier, bought and paid for, funneled money into a law firm into an op research group, to a foreign national.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The bunk lies the author wouldn't even himself stand by when pressed in an interrogatory in Great Britain. Then, the leaking of such information to influence the 2016 elections, lies about Donald Trump paid for from Russia. And then of course, being used to appoint a special counsel. It is all of that on the table for you?

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: You know, to my Democratic friends, if you want to look backwards, we are all going to look backwards. I want to know why the FBI reached to the conclusion along with the Department of Justice that Hillary Clinton didn't commit a crime. Was it because of political bias? If you really wanted to stop Trump, how in the world could you indict her? Was the reason she wasn't indicted is because they wanted to make sure they stop Trump and how can you stop him if you indict her?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Did the Department of Justice and the FBI use a document paid for by the Democratic Party? Research by foreign agents to get a warrant against an American citizen that was inappropriate, potentially unlawful? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } We need a special counsel to look at all of this. But I intend to look at it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I agree.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I'm going to look at it. If you are going to keep plowing everything up in 2016, count me in. If you want to look for it, I will look for it. If you want to look back, we will all going to look back to everything and everybody. Not just a Trump.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you this. I forgot the fraud on the FISA court, because that was the--

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: That's the fraud on the FISA court.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: -- Grassley-Graham memo. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The bulk of -- quote, "the bulk of information came from the phony, unverified, uncorroborated dossier that mostly has been debunked." You know, there's a proposal by the White House today about prison reform.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I had the opportunity. We also had the video of Alice Marie Johnson, and when -- one defense, it was serious, 22 years in jail, raced out to the arms of her family. It was beyond a touching moment. And said thank you, America, for giving me a second chance, I'll not let you down when the president pardoned her. And I look at prison reform. We've got two million people in jail.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: In a five-year period, a 77 percent recidivism rate. I want to find every Alice Marie Johnson in America and I'd love the president to pardon one such person, 10 people a day if we can do that, because I think we do need real reform. There is unfairness in the system.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes. Wouldn't it be ironic if it was Donald Trump who fixed the problems created by the three strikes, you out rule passed by Bill Clinton? Wouldn't it be ironic it was Donald Trump and the Republican Congress working with Democrats that allowed just thousands of African-American and Hispanic males a second chance for nonviolent offenses? And create bed space for truly violent people.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Well, punishment is not working. If you have a 77 percent recidivism rate, locking you up in a place with bad people and you're not helping or advancing and changing hearts and minds, it makes sense to me. But senator, well follow that more. I think there is a lot of potential there.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, sure.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Imagine the president transforming the power of the pardon for every Alice Marie Johnson who I met and is an amazing woman. I think it would be great for the country.

utterances.speaker: GRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, getting minorities out of jail, giving them a second chance, improving the economy for African-American, Hispanic families is a very big deal.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Senator, good to see you. Thank you for being with us. When we come back, I'm not taking on one. No. It's kind of always unfair when a conservative debates a liberal. I'm taking on two. I'll explain next. We also have deep state news and an update on the Mueller investigation. Sara Carter, Gregg Jarrett, they have the latest, and Trace Gallagher here he will give us an update on Michael Avenatti's arrest as Hannity continues. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. So, some of the migrant caravan have arrived at our southern border and now we see thousands of others also coming. The A.P. reporting, quote, "migrant caravan groups arrived by hundreds at U.S. border." Joining us now for a debate, former chair of the council of economic advisor of President Obama, Austan Goolsbee, and civil rights attorney, Daryl Parks. Austan, it's so good to see you, you know why? Because I just played at the beginning of the show, I hope you are watching a guy by the name of Barack Obama, who you love! You absolutely adore and who I think did a horrible job. OK. We disagree. And he sounded like Donald Trump about protecting our borders, respecting our sovereignty. What has happened from then until now?

utterances.speaker: AUSTAN GOOLSBEE, FORMER BARACK OBAMA CHIEF ECONOMIST
utterances.sentences: Only good things. You know, look, Sean, you and I have been friends for a long time.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: And I will say among Democrats, among liberals, I'm totally in agreement that a country should control who comes into that country. So we should secure the border.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Hang on. Mark this moment, that means you and your wife, who I have met and had dinner with, I finally had influence with you.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We are making progress.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: Well, look, here's what I'm saying. The caravan -- I'm glad you are at least following up on this. The president was out Trumpeting this as an invasion and the biggest threat to national security. The vast majority of the people in this caravan are still in the city of Guadalajara which is a 800, 900 miles away from the U.S. border.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: But they are now getting transportation.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: And there are women escaping domestic violence in Guatemala. There are four-year old kids -- this is not what we should be -- if you're concerned about border security--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Well, let me tell you why we should be concern.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: -- let's put the focus where it should be. Not on these kids.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Daryl, let me -- let me concede. Putting aside, 300 have been identified by both Mexican officials and Department of Homeland Security as to be bad elements that are trying to mix in with the caravan crowd of migrants. And as I watch them, I would argue probably 99 plus percent are good people, live in poverty, horrible lives, want what we all take for granted in this country. It's the 300 others that we have to worry about. Here's what I am afraid of. Here's the video of what happened at the southern border in Mexico. And that is they take defense, they knock it down, they race across the border. For the safety and security of everybody, if this happens on our southern border, I don't want anybody hurt. All we are asking, if you want to come to this country, to do it legally. You are a lawyer. Do you respect the law?

utterances.speaker: DARYL PARKS, CRIMINAL DEFENSE ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Without question we respect the law, Sean. And we expect that those people who want to get to the border they are going to do the right thing. These people are -- we shouldn't demonize them. They are trying to escape poverty, they are trying to escape political instability.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I didn't demonize -- did I demonize?

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: I know you didn't. And I'm glad you didn't. You didn't. Tonight, you are doing great, Sean. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Tonight, I'm doing great, all right. Just tonight, though.

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: You are doing great tonight. You do well all the time, but tonight you are doing great. Let me say this thing.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I know you are doing better tonight.

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: These people are looking for a better opportunity. They are looking for better opportunities like all of us in America. I'm sure once they get in, they'll follow their rules.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: But we have laws.

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: I don't think we need to be in--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We are a constitutional republic. We have borders, sovereignty, laws.

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: Yes, we are.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And if you really want to be here, the first -- the first prerequisite has to be, obey our laws, respect our laws. Don't just take it upon yourself.

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: I agree with Daryl. You know, the only think I'd say--

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: But at this point we have no indication that they are going to break the rules.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true. And remember, our law, if you are coming to apply for asylum, our law requires you to come to a port of entry to apply for asylum. Hundreds of these migrants are literally trying to make appointments to come in and apply for asylum, and we've sent 15,000 U.S. troops skipping their Thanksgiving with their family to go down there and do nothing.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Well, Austan, the problem is this. You know, we saw what happened -- we just played the tape what happened at the southern Mexico border. We can't have that happen here. And I'll tell you why.

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: But Sean, a few people--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The first people that need to be protected are the innocent people that want a better life, let's protect them first.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: OK, I agree with that. We can all agree on that. Yes. Now 40 percent of the people--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: This is a really bad--

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: -- that come to the U.S. illegally, 40 percent of the people that come to the U.S. illegally come to the airport, Sean. They come in and then they overstay their visas.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And we are trying to make improvements there as well, Daryl.

utterances.speaker: PARKS
utterances.sentences: Well, without question. I hope and pray these people will come, they will apply properly and they will get the opportunities that our country can provide them to and be--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I think you should give them pro bono legal work. I think you should do them for free and Austan will help pay for it because he's a really rich guy.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: When you finally pay me for my bet, Sean, I will be a rich guy.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I have overpaid you for your debt. you don't remember the dinner I paid for?

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: Wait a minute, wait a minute, you did pay for that dinner, but that was on a technicality.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: A technicality! A thousand dollars--

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: But you bet me six -- you said Obamacare was going to cost 100 million people their insurance. So, I'm still waiting for that one.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Excuse me, millions -- OK, the cost--

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: You said 100 million.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: -- is between 100, 200, and 300 percent -- so many counties have one option. Many millions lost their doctors, their plans and everybody is paying more. Broken promises.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: Yes, but not 100 million. So, you are going to be paying me more!

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Well, what do you say to the millions of Americans paying more, lost their doctor, lost their plan, only have one option now? That's it.

utterances.speaker: GOOLSBEE
utterances.sentences: I tell those people to say, thanks, President Trump.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You've lost your mind. But see, it takes two liberals, once conservative. This way it works. Anyway, thank you both. When we come back, we have some big breaking news, Sara Carter, Gregg Jarrett. Surprising developments in the Mueller probe. Also, the latest on Michael Avenatti's arrest from earlier tonight. Does he tonight believe in due process? Has he changed his mind on the presumption of innocence? That straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. The Mueller investigation maybe finally wrapping up tonight, the Trump administration, according to reports, maybe turning written responses to questions from special counsel as early as this week. And today, in the U.S. Senate, Mitch McConnell blocked the legislation put forth by Senator, well, Jeff 'snow' Flake that would, quote, "protect Mueller from being fired." Even though President Trump said he's not firing him. Here with reaction, the author of the number one New York Times bestseller, "The Russia Hoax: The Illicit Scheme to Clear Hillary Clinton and Frame Donald Trump," Fox News legal analyst Gregg Jarrett, Fox News contributor, Sara Carter. Sar, you just heard Lindsey Graham, and very clear that starting in the beginning, Hillary Clinton, exoneration before an investigation. Then of course the FISA abuse and FISA court fraud that was committed, the bulk of information being the unverified dossier that not even Christopher Steele would stand by, and of course trying to influence the 2016 election with bought and paid for Russian lies and using the false information circular reporting to also influence the appointment of special counsel. A lot there.

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: A lot there, Sean. And I think Senator Graham is right off the money. If we get Senator Graham and he takes the chairmanship of the Senate judiciary committee, I can guarantee you that he's going to move forward with this. The American people need this. They want this to wrap up. They want to know the truth. This is why not only does there need to be an investigation by the Senate judiciary committee, but we also need those documents declassified and only the president can do this. The only way to get to the truth is to get transparency, to get those documents declassified. That's the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act warrant on Carter Page. We also need the gang of eight to find her.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The gang of eight, 302's.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Yes, and the 302s by Bruce Ohr. This is what needs to be done now so that we can move forward.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You know, it's interesting. Because Donald Trump was able to defy the history of Bill Clinton who lost 60 seats, eight Senate seats in his first midterm. Obama who lost, Gregg, six seats in the Senate but 63 House seats. And he fought to keep the Senate as hard as he did.

utterances.speaker: GREGG JARRETT, FOX NEWS LEGAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: It's rather profound now because all of the threats that the Democrats are making, all of this would move right over to the U.S. Senate, wouldn't it?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: Right. It's absolutely would.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And oversight.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: And Lindsey Graham is the perfect person to conduct the investigation. Because he knows there is a plethora of evidence that there was an illicit scheme by the FBI and Department of Justice to clear Hillary Clinton and frame Donald Trump. And he would reopen the Hillary Clinton email case -- you know, it's a crime for an FBI director or official or agent--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Eighteen USC 793 I have it etched in my brain.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: Yes. It is a crime to hide incriminating evidence and to make a decision about a case, the Clinton case, for political reasons. So Lindsey Graham will investigate that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you this. If it's true, all the reports that there are going to be written answers only on Russia, not on any obstruction -- because the president can fire anybody he wants. You know, Jerry Nadler saying, well, he wants to investigate, you know, what the president said -- it's meaningless if he said something, didn't do it. But is this the beginning of the end if, in fact, there is not going to be a subpoena, written answers are going to be handed in? It sounds like the airplane is now heading in for a landing, Sara.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: It is. It is. Every source that I've spoken with tonight and over the past week says that Mueller is going to wrap up this investigation. We are not going to see anything happen to President Trump. What we might see is some indictments, maybe Roger Stone, Jerome Corsi who is his assistant, Roger Stone's assistant very closely involved with him. One of the things that I did, Sean, that to me is so important, and there was never any evidence -- never, from the very beginning of this investigation by the FBI, that there was any kind of collusion, which isn't a crime anyway, but there was never any evidence--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: None.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: -- the the Trump campaign was working with the Russians.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Only on Hillary's side.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Only on Hillary's side. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We only have about 40 seconds I want to give it to Gregg. I believe in due process deeply.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The presumption of innocence, you are on a lot with us during the Kavanaugh hearings. Michael Avenatti serious charges tonight. I believe he deserves that also.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: He does.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: I'm sincere.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: You should be commended for what you said about that. Because everybody, including Michael Avenatti, deserves the presumption of innocence and due process, but isn't it ironic that Avenatti was the one who didn't want to afford due process and presumption of innocence to Brett Kavanaugh?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: I wonder how he feels tonight.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's the question. You know, does he now believe in that? Because he is claiming his innocence? And as a matter of fact -- thank you, both. We will have a full report and an update on Michael Avenatti's arrest as we continue tonight on HANNITY.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Joining us now with the very latest news on the arrest, serious charges, Stormy Daniels' lawyer, Michael Avenatti, Fox News Correspondent, Trace Gallagher. Trace, very serious charges, it's a very strong denial by attorney Michael Avenatti. Tell us.

utterances.speaker: TRACE GALLAGHER, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes, Sean. Michael Avenatti was booked on felony domestic violence. The Los Angeles Police Department wouldn't identify the alleged victim or say how Avenatti knew her, but police did say she had visible injuries. And TMZ is reporting the injuries were on her face and were, quote, "serious." There are also reports that Avenatti says she hit him first, calling the situation, quote, "B.S." Police say the alleged violence happened yesterday in West Los Angeles. Avenatti was arrested today and posted a $50,000 bond just a short time ago. When he walked out of jail, Avenatti diplomatically thanked the police for their hard work and then said this. Watch.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL AVENATTI, STORMY DANIELS' ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: I have never struck a woman. I never will strike a woman. I have been an advocate for women's rights my entire career and I'm going to continue to be an advocate. I am not going to be intimidated from stopping what I am doing.

utterances.speaker: GALLAGHER
utterances.sentences: Unclear exactly what he's, quote, "doing," but there's been talk of a 2020 presidential run. He was reportedly set to speak this weekend at events for the Vermont Democratic Party but had to cancel. Avenatti became well known for being Stormy Daniels' attorney and then brought forward serious allegations against Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh. Those allegations were later knocked down. We don't know when the Avenatti has to appear in court again. Sean?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: OK. And these are felony charges, correct, that we are looking at?

utterances.speaker: GALLAGHER
utterances.sentences: Felony assault charges against him. Very serious. Don't know what the jail time is, but these are serious charges if proven.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Trace Gallagher, thank you. I do believe in due process, presumption of innocence. And it should take place here as well.  Let not your heart be troubled. We're always fair, balanced, not the destroy-Trump media. Laura Ingraham? Take it away. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
